page.title: 19GREAT MASCALLS FARM C'FORD
page.content: A house has been on this site since the 13th century.The present owners inherited the farm from their father in 1968.In 1937,in their granfather's time,there were 250 acres and 13 men to work them.They grew potatoes,oats, beans and peas.Now there are 650acres though 24 have been taken for the New Chelmsford By Pass.Now four men work on the farm and they grow wheat,barley peas and rape.As well as crops and a dairy herd of 80 cows,they have a few sheep and turkeys at Christmas time. In 1937 it took a man with a pair of horses a day to plough a field.Now a combine harvester ploughs 3/4 acres an hour.In 1937 one man looked after 12 cows, now one man looks after 80.In 1937 an average wage was about Â£1.25 a week,now it is about Â£100.
